2013-08-01-d3-website.title: d3® Website
2013-08-01-d3-website.content:
In 2013 e-see® was approached by d3® a New Zealand company co-founded by All Black legend Craig Dowd. Craig was in need of a website that would complement his existing brand.

I designed and built a responsive website based on Twitter Bootstrap, making use of great photography and strong colour contrasts. The website had to display multiple products and (fluid) videos of how to use them.
2013-08-01-d3-website.author: Tim Geurts

2013-06-01-selected-autos-webapp.title: Selected Autos Webapp
2013-06-01-selected-autos-webapp.content:
In June 2013 Selected Autos asked e-see® to rebuild their existing website. The catch was that this site was a blog based catalogue of their vehicles and they wanted the new site to look like an app and provide an easier method for them to manage their vehicle listings.

I build the site on top of Adobe Business Catalyst and created a web app feel through custom Ajax to manage the vehicle catalogue and customised Twitter Bootstrap styling. The site uses typeahead filtering and has a management section that allows a manager to create and edit listings and upload photos.
2013-06-01-selected-autos-webapp.author: Tim Geurts

2013-08-01-rainbow-ecommerce-site.title: Rainbow Ecommerce Site
2013-08-01-rainbow-ecommerce-site.content:
In August Rainbow Confectionery approached e-see® to add ecommerce functionality to the website we had previously built for them. As the site was built on Adobe Business Catalyst I leveraged the systems ecommerce capabilities and quickly had a solution for them.

This website was designed to have the feel of an old fashioned lolly shop with cue's taken from Rainbow's long history as one on New Zealand's oldest confectionery makers. It was designed and built on top of Adobe Business Catalyst for all markets. Working with the Oamaru (NZ) based management team. Features include full CMS with staff access for editing. Unique horizontal slider layout with hand illustrated images and backgrounds. Social integration.
2013-08-01-rainbow-ecommerce-site.author: Tim Geurts

2014-01-20-graffiti-media-website.title: Graffiti Media Website
2014-01-20-graffiti-media-website.content:
As a contractor I have kept providing support and working on projects for e-see®. In January I was approached to reskin Graffiti Media, a Video Porduction company based in Los Angeles and New Zealand.

On the original project I worked with the Graffiti team in both Los Angeles and New Zealand to build a very simple design using the Vimeo video service to embed demo reels into the site. Graffiti staff can show demo reels no matter where they are, in the office, on location, at the client or over coffee.
2014-01-20-graffiti-media-website.author: Tim Geurts

2012-10-01-autohub-website.title: Autohub Website
2012-10-01-autohub-website.content:
AUTOHUB is New Zealands largest shipper of Motor-vehicles into New Zealand and works throughout the world transporting vehicles from around the world to clients in UK, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa and Russia.

While at e-see® we worked with senior management in New Zealand and Japan and first developed the AUTOHUB brand then the public facing websites.

AUTOHUB's existing website was rebuilt using responsive technologies to work well across many browsers and devices including mobile phones. The is site built on Adobe™ Business Catalyst using the Bootstrap framework, features integrated SalesForce™ lead and booking forms. Links to external Management services, multiple domains and more.
2012-10-01-autohub-website.author: Tim Geurts

2013-07-01-southern-cross-brand-manageme.title: Southern Cross Brand Management Webapp
2013-07-01-southern-cross-brand-manageme.content:
In 2013 e-see® pitched a Brand Management System concept to Southern Cross Health Society, a not for profit health insurer in New Zealand.

e-see® already provided a Digital Asset Management system to Southern Cross but we felt due to the importance of their brand they would be better suited with a webapp that would provide a similar experience in a more on-brand manner.

On the desktop the content get plenty of room to breath to keep in style with Southern Crosses Brand.

Assets have different views depending on a user access level. If the user has access to the asset they can download it and see more info. Some assets are completely hidden from users with insufficient permissions. The permission system required careful coding to keep everything secure on a system that doesn't natively support these features.
2013-07-01-southern-cross-brand-manageme.author: Tim Geurts

2012-07-01-mobistore-website.title: Mobistore Website
2012-07-01-mobistore-website.content:
A new storage business in Auckland, Mobistore asked e-see® to develop a completely new web presence and booking system for Mobistore's Stress Free Moving and Storage boxes.

Mobistore was built in HTML and uses Business Catalyst device detection and jQuery Mobile for mobile devices. The site features secure login, Ecommerce, CRM, Booking engine, Admin functionality, address and map lookups with Google Maps integration and a hand drawn horizontal scroller in the desktop version of the site.
2012-07-01-mobistore-website.author: Tim Geurts
